result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwan Kevon White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 3 and consecutive to any other case; credit for 72 days time served

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC; remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
- No possession of illegal drugs.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Serve 4 months condition time in HOC; concurrent as to both counts

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2 and consecutive to any other case; credit for 72 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwan Kevon White

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Antwan Kevon White in court, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Antwan Kevon White.  Prosecuting attorney Catelin Ringersma appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 2 and 3.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of  5 YEARS, concurrent to count 3 and consecutive to any other case. 72 DAYS credit for time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of  2 YEARS, concurrent to count 2 and consecutive to any other case. 72 DAYS credit for time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 4 months condition time in the House of Correction; concurrent as to both counts. 
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
- No possession of illegal drugs. 

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.


*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Prior Felony Conviction Certs , filed.
Jury Instruction: Felon in Possession of Firearm, filed.
Jury Instruction: Possession of Controlled Substance (Narcotic), filed.

Guilty Plea Questionnaire, filed.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea, filed.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case in court for status/scheduling conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.

Defendant Antwan Kevon White in court, appear by video with attorney Tedia K. Gamino, appear by video.  Defendant Antwan Kevon White in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 19CF2538.  Sworn for the State:    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is housed in Racine County and not scheduled for today. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Antwan Kevon White in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Antwan Kevon White in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antwan Kevon White appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
